task_summary: Detect the drawer handle, approach and align, grasp it, pull to open the drawer, then retreat and release.

task_long_description.overview: A Stretch-like mobile manipulator operates in a kitchen scene with a wooden cabinet and drawers beneath a dark countertop. The robot must open a drawer by grasping its handle and pulling it outward. The contact-sheet shows progressive approach, alignment, contact, and an outward motion that increases drawer opening across frames. The plan prioritizes reliable perception and alignment, a firm yet moderate grasp, and a straight pull along the drawer’s opening axis, followed by a safe retreat and release.
preconditions: Drawer is reachable by the end effector
Handle (drawer_handle) is at least partly visible
Workspace is free of obstructions around pull path
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to handle with tight tolerance
Set end-effector yaw to 90° to match handle
Pull along x axis by 0.2 m
success_criteria: Drawer front translates outward visibly by several centimeters
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: re-detect or scan area
If alignment fails: re-approach with same tolerance
If grasp slips: reopen, realign, and regrasp with higher force (within limits)
If pull obstructed: retreat slightly and retry pull
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after ContainerOpen confirms success and the retreat + release steps complete.

frame_3.now_evidence: First firm grasp appears established with gripper centered on handle.
frame_3.predicts_next: An outward pull along the drawer axis is expected immediately after.

node_specs.description: Open gripper to clear approach and later to release.
Move the end-effector to the handle and align precisely.
Verify the handle remains visible and aligned.
Rotate wrist to grasp handle appropriately.
Secure the handle with moderate force.
Pull straight along opening axis to open drawer.
Back away to avoid collisions after opening.

failure_modes: Collision with cabinet face during pull
recovery_strategy: Adjust yaw and tolerance then retry grasp
Increase force one step and retry
Retreat slightly and try a shorter pull
assumptions: Handle appears bar-like and graspable; pull axis approximated as +x relative to robot base
Pull distance 0.2 m chosen to match visible opening in frames
Images suggest no obstacles directly behind drawer front

expected_success_criteria: ContainerOpen returns success and drawer translation visible
